heading: HB06797
0:
AN ACT AUTHORIZING THE SECRETARY OF EDUCATION TO DEFER THE START OF
THE SCHOOL YEAR IN CASE OF A DECLARATION OF A STATE OF
EMERGENCY, STATE OF CALAMITY OR ANY SIMILAR OCCURRENCE,
AMENDING FOR THE PURPOSE REPUBLIC ACT NO. 7797, OTHERWISE
KNOWN AS “AN ACT TO LENGTHEN THE SCHOOL CALENDAR FROM TWO
HUNDRED DAYS TO NOT MORE THAN TWO HUNDRED TWENTY CLASS
DAYS
status: Pending with the Committee on DEFEAT COVID-19 AD-HOC COMMITTEE since 2020-05-27
history:
House Bill/Resolution NO. HB06797
FULL TITLE : AN ACT AUTHORIZING THE SECRETARY OF EDUCATION TO DEFER THE START OF THE SCHOOL YEAR IN CASE OF A DECLARATION OF A STATE OF EMERGENCY, STATE OF CALAMITY OR ANY SIMILAR OCCURRENCE, AMENDING FOR THE PURPOSE REPUBLIC ACT NO. 7797, OTHERWISE KNOWN AS “AN ACT TO LENGTHEN THE SCHOOL CALENDAR FROM TWO HUNDRED DAYS TO NOT MORE THAN TWO HUNDRED TWENTY CLASS DAYS
PRINCIPAL AUTHOR/S : CABOCHAN, MANUEL III. D.
DATE FILED : 2020-05-25
SIGNIFICANCE: NATIONAL
ACTIONS TAKEN BY THE COMMITTEE ON RULES
REFERRAL TO THE COMMITTEE ON DEFEAT COVID-19 AD-HOC COMMITTEE ON 2020-05-27
